title: How to Repair a Mercury Thermometer

steps.title: Inspect the thermometer for damage.
steps.content: Inspect the thermometer for damage. Do not use it anymore if it is cracked or damaged in any way. It has served its life and needs to be disposed of properly (see Warnings below). [1] X Trustworthy Source U.S. National Capital Poison Center Independent poison control center providing resources to prevent poisonings and save lives Go to source

steps.title: Choose a method for repairing the separated mercury.
steps.content: Choose a method for repairing the separated mercury.

steps.title: Place the thermometer in a refrigerator or ideally, a freezer.
steps.content: Place the thermometer in a refrigerator or ideally, a freezer. If cold enough, it should send the mercury (or other indicating fluid) to the bulb with little else to do. See the next steps if a refrigerator or freezer is not available or did not work.

steps.title: Place the thermometer in the sink.
steps.content: Place the thermometer in the sink.

steps.title: Gradually heat the bulb with a hair dryer on warm.
steps.content: Gradually heat the bulb with a hair dryer on warm. The mercury will rise to the top of the thermometer and join together.

steps.title: Allow the thermometer to gradually cool down to room temperature.
steps.content: Allow the thermometer to gradually cool down to room temperature.

steps.title: If you need to take several attempts, just heat and cool gradually.
steps.content: If you need to take several attempts, just heat and cool gradually. Do not overheat, as the thermometer could burst. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Firmly grasp the thermometer near the top, so that the bulb containing the mercury (or other indicating fluid) is pointed downward.
steps.content: Firmly grasp the thermometer near the top, so that the bulb containing the mercury (or other indicating fluid) is pointed downward. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Rapidly move the thermometer down and sharply reverse direction (and snap the wrist upward).
steps.content: Rapidly move the thermometer down and sharply reverse direction (and snap the wrist upward). When the thermometer reaches the lowest point of the stroke several times. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Recheck the indicated temperature.
steps.content: Recheck the indicated temperature. If the indicated temperature has been reduced from the last time checked, continue shaking the thermometer downward. It will likely require repeating many times before the void in the column has disappeared.

steps.title: Hold the thermometer vertically - with the bulb directed downward.
steps.content: Hold the thermometer vertically - with the bulb directed downward.

steps.title: Drop the thermometer on a bed, pillow, or even a towel folded so that it is 8 (or more) times the non-folded thickness.
steps.content: Drop the thermometer on a bed, pillow, or even a towel folded so that it is 8 (or more) times the non-folded thickness. Not more than a one or two foot drop is recommended. [6] X Research source
